p: A total of 14,328 neuraminidase (NA) nucleotide sequences longer than 1330 nts, excluding laboratory recombinant sequences, were downloaded from the Influenza Virus Resource at NCBI [53]. Their host distributions are detailed in Table 4. A Perl script ( http://sysbio.harvard.edu) was used to remove identical sequences, which resulted in 10,679 NA sequences, including 10,001 influenza A and 678 influenza B sequences. The influenza A NA sequences were divided into nine datasets (one for each subtype) that consist of 4146, 3754, 351, 85, 128, 488, 189, 684, and 176 sequences respectively for N1â€“N9.
